title: Section C
passagesOne: Questions 46 to 50 are based on the following passage.

questionsOne.Statement: What does the project Writing On It All invite people to do?

Options.text: Unlearn their training in drawing.
Participate in a state graffiti show.
Cover the walls of an old house with graffiti.
Exhibit their artistic creations in an old house.

questionsOne.Statement: What do we learn about the participants in the project?

Options.text: They are just culture addicts.
They are graffiti enthusiasts.
They are writers and artists.
They are mostly passers-by.

questionsOne.Statement: What did the project participants do during the 2016 season?

Options.text: They were free to scribble on the walls whatever came to their mind.
They expressed their thoughts in graffiti on the theme of each session.
They learned the techniques of collaborative writing.
They were required to cooperate with other creators.

questionsOne.Statement: What kind of place is Governor’s Island?

Options.text: It is a historic site that attracts tourists and artists.
It is an area now accessible only to tourist vehicles.
It is a place in Upper New York Bay formerly used for exiles.
It is an open area for tourists to enjoy themselves year round.

questionsOne.Statement: What does Chasin say about the project?

Options.text: It just focused on the sufferings of black females.
It helped expand the influence of graffiti art.
It has started the career of many creative artists.
It has created some meaningful artistic works.

passagesTwo: Questions 51 to 55 are based on the following passage.

questionsTwo.Statement: What does the recent study say about online CBT programs?

Options.text: Patients may not be able to carry them through for effective cure.
Patients cannot engage with them without the use of a computer.
They can save patients trouble visiting physicians.
They have been well received by a lot of patients.

questionsTwo.Statement: What has made online CBT programs increasingly popular?

Options.text: Their effectiveness in combating depression.
The low efficiency of traditional talk therapy.
Their easy and inexpensive access by patients.
The recommendation by primary care doctors.

questionsTwo.Statement: What is the major finding by researchers at the University of York?

Options.text: Online CBT programs are no more effective than regular care from physicians.
The process of treating depression is often more complicated than anticipated.
The combination of traditional CBT and computerized CBT is most effective.
Depression is a mental condition which is to be treated with extreme caution.

questionsTwo.Statement: What is Professor Dowrick’s advice concerning online CBT programs?

Options.text: They should not be neglected in primary care.
Their effectiveness should not be overestimated.
They should be used by strictly following instructions.
Their use should be encouraged by doctors and therapists.

questionsTwo.Statement: What is more important to an emotionally vulnerable person?

Options.text: A positive state of mind.
Appropriate medication.
Timely encouragement.
Human interaction.
